PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Projeto UNIVERSAL- CNPq N 14/2011 O objetivo precpuo deste Projeto o de realizar no mbito do Instituto de Estudos Avanados (IEAv) e do Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (ITA), uma estrutura para pesquisa cientfica e desenvolvimento tecnolgico de dispositivos pticos integrados relacionados com a emergente e promissora rea de Fotnica Integrada em Silcio, tendo como foco principal dispositivos fotnicos em silcio de dimenses micro e nanomtricas, bem como de dispositivos que apresentem propriedades inovadoras decorrentes da integrao de dispositivos fotnicos em silcio; secundariamente, este Projeto visa a consolidar essa rea de pesquisa no Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (ITA). Ambas as supracitadas instituies (ITA e IEAv) pertencem ao Departamento-Geral de Tecnologia Aeroespacial (DCTA) do Comando da Aeronutica. A linha de pesquisa cientfica e desenvolvimento tecnolgico contemplada neste Projeto encontra-se relacionada com os Dispositivos de Alto Contraste de ndices de Refrao. De modo a atingir o objetivo precpuo deste Projeto, a linha de pesquisa contemplar objetivos especficos, conforme descrio detalhada a seguir; esses objetivos sero alcanados sinergicamente mediante a assistncia eventual (terica e/ou experimental) dos pesquisadores, colaboradores e alunos deste Projeto, os quais atuaro sob a coordenao, fiscalizao e responsabilidade deste Pesquisador-Proponente.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Planar Printed Photonic Straingauge System for Mobile Platforms
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: With the emergence of new materials as well as the need to extend their performance beyond conventional engineering limits, the in-situ continuous measurement of mechanical strain in structural elements will gain importance. Fortunately, it is now possible to measure mechanical deflections with compact electrical strain gauges. However, each strain gauge requires a separate wire, and fully characterized systems can become bulky and heavy. Here we show a method for using optical waveguides on the surfaces of the structural elements to determine the instantaneous strain observed at these surfaces. The system described here relies on the use of lithographically defined gratings within waveguides, which can be printed onto the surface of critical structural elements

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: FEGADOLLI, W. S.;Fegadolli, William S.;FEGADOLLI, WILLIAM DOS SANTOS;FEGADOLLI, WILLIAM

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: An Enhanced Quarter-Sized Optical NEMS Based Methyl Salicylate Sensor System (MS3)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The United States Department of Defense (DoD) is testing next generation personal protection systems to protect U.S. military personnel from chemical threats. Some of these programs focus on Man-in-Simulant Testing (MIST), where methyl salicylate (MeS) is used to test the effectiveness of chemical suits. Currently, the suits are tested with passive absorbent pads to collect samples while soldiers or mannequins wear the suits during MeS exposure. To identify weaknesses that may exist in the system, i.e. chemical break-through sites; small, unobtrusive and light weight sensors are needed to collect near-real-time data as the suits are used during tests. A key requirement of this application is that the proposed sensors do not interfere with airflow through the suit or with the wearer s mobility. This significantly restricts the size and power of a viable sensor system. Furthermore, the sensor system must be able to function accurately in a rapidly fluctuating (concentration and air flow) environment, and operate from a 0 to 40 degrees Celsius in a high humidity (>90% Relative Humidity) environment, while remaining unaffected after exposure to environmental factors including human sweat, and human body odors. The sensor system must be small so it may be placed in a number of body regions (sufficient to cover areas likely to leak, track leak flow patterns, and monitor sensitive regions), while not inhibiting the free movement of the test subject, and not attenuate, enhance or redirect normal circulation of air beneath the garment. The sensor system must be able to integrate with central data telemetry and/or a data logging systems and have sufficient on-board power for missions which can span between four and eight hours. In response to this need, we proposed to develop a breadboard , real-time Optical NEMS Based Methyl Salicylate Sensor, capable of accurately measuring the exposure of skin beneath a protective garment to a chemical agent simulant

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Este trabalho se trata de um projeto comum, no qual esto envolvidos sete alunos de graduao. O trabalho consiste em analisar e desenvolver sensores fibra ptica serem utilizados em diversas aplicaes, tais como: sensores de presena, anti-esmagamento e de presso, dentre outras aplicaes.
Cabe observar que esta atividade, de cunho extracurricular, resultar em um trabalho a ser apresentado na edio anual da feira de cincias do ITA que ocorrer em outubro de 2008 nas dependncias do respectivo instituto.
